properties.name: allCaps
properties.description:
Specifies whether the font is formatted as all capital letters, which makes lowercase letters appear as uppercase letters. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text has the All Caps attribute.
- false: None of the text has the All Caps attribute.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text has the All Caps attribute.

examples.description: Set the selected text to display in all capital letters using the allCaps formatting

properties.name: bold
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font is bold. True if the font is formatted as bold, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Apply bold formatting to the currently selected text in the document.

properties.name: boldBidirectional
properties.description:
Specifies whether the font is formatted as bold in a right-to-left language document. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text is bold.
- false: None of the text is bold.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text is bold.

examples.description: Set the selected text to bold formatting for right-to-left language content (such as Arabic or Hebrew)

properties.name: borders
properties.description: Returns a BorderUniversalCollection object that represents all the borders for the font.

examples.description: Add a red double-line border around all text formatted with a specific font style

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the color for the specified font. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name.

examples.description: Change the font color of the currently selected text to blue.

properties.name: colorIndex
properties.description: Specifies a ColorIndex value that represents the color for the font.

examples.description: Set the font color of the selected text to red using the color index

properties.name: colorIndexBidirectional
properties.description: Specifies the color for the Font object in a right-to-left language document.

examples.description: Set the font color to red for Arabic text in a right-to-left language document

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context to verify the Office host connection before applying font formatting operations

properties.name: contextualAlternates
properties.description: Specifies whether contextual alternates are enabled for the font.

examples.description: Enable contextual alternates for the selected text to improve the appearance of letter combinations

properties.name: diacriticColor
properties.description: Specifies the color to be used for diacritics for the Font object. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format.

examples.description: Set the diacritics color to red for the selected text in the document

properties.name: disableCharacterSpaceGrid
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word ignores the number of characters per line for the corresponding Font object.

examples.description: Disable the character space grid for the selected text so that Word ignores character-per-line spacing constraints

properties.name: doubleStrikeThrough
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font has a double strikethrough. True if the font is formatted as double strikethrough text, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Apply double strikethrough formatting to the selected text in the document

properties.name: emboss
properties.description:
Specifies whether the font is formatted as embossed. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text is embossed.
- false: None of the text is embossed.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text is embossed.

examples.description: Apply embossed formatting to the selected text in the document

properties.name: emphasisMark
properties.description: Specifies an EmphasisMark value that represents the emphasis mark for a character or designated character string.

examples.description: Add emphasis marks above the selected text using solid circles to highlight important terms in a document.

properties.name: engrave
properties.description:
Specifies whether the font is formatted as engraved. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text is engraved.
- false: None of the text is engraved.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text is engraved.

examples.description: Apply engraved formatting to the selected text in the document

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Returns a FillFormat object that contains fill formatting properties for the font used by the range of text.

examples.description: Set the font fill color to solid blue for the selected text in the document.

properties.name: glow
properties.description: Returns a GlowFormat object that represents the glow formatting for the font used by the range of text.

examples.description: Apply a blue glow effect with 8pt size to the selected text in the document

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font is tagged as hidden. True if the font is formatted as hidden text, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Mark selected text as hidden so it won't be visible when printed or displayed

properties.name: highlightColor
properties.description: Specifies the highlight color. To set it, use a value either in the '#RRGGBB' format or the color name. To remove highlight color, set it to null. The returned highlight color can be in the '#RRGGBB' format, an empty string for mixed highlight colors, or null for no highlight color. Note: Only the default highlight colors are available in Office for Windows Desktop. These are "Yellow", "Lime", "Turquoise", "Pink", "Blue", "Red", "DarkBlue", "Teal", "Green", "Purple", "DarkRed", "Olive", "Gray", "LightGray", and "Black". When the add-in runs in Office for Windows Desktop, any other color is converted to the closest color when applied to the font.

examples.description: Highlight the currently selected text in the document with a yellow background color.

properties.name: italic
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font is italicized. True if the font is italicized, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Make the text in the first paragraph italic

properties.name: italicBidirectional
properties.description:
Specifies whether the font is italicized in a right-to-left language document. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text is italicized.
- false: None of the text is italicized.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text is italicized.

examples.description: Set the selected text to italic formatting for right-to-left language content (such as Arabic or Hebrew)

properties.name: kerning
properties.description: Specifies the minimum font size for which Microsoft Word will adjust kerning automatically.

examples.description: Set the minimum font size to 12 points for automatic kerning adjustment on the selected text

properties.name: ligature
properties.description: Specifies the ligature setting for the Font object.

examples.description: Set the ligature setting to "Standard" for the selected text to enable standard typographic ligatures

properties.name: line
properties.description: Returns a LineFormat object that specifies the formatting for a line.

examples.description: Set the underline style to single and change the underline color to red for selected text

properties.name: name
properties.description: Specifies a value that represents the name of the font.

examples.description: Change the font name of the currently selected text to Arial.

properties.name: nameAscii
properties.description: Specifies the font used for Latin text (characters with character codes from 0 (zero) through 127).

examples.description: Set the font for Latin characters in the selected text to "Courier New"

properties.name: nameBidirectional
properties.description: Specifies the font name in a right-to-left language document.

examples.description: Set the bidirectional font name to "Arial" for the selected text in a right-to-left language document

properties.name: nameFarEast
properties.description: Specifies the East Asian font name.

examples.description: Set the East Asian font name to "MS Mincho" for the selected text in the document.

properties.name: nameOther
properties.description: Specifies the font used for characters with codes from 128 through 255.

examples.description: Set the font for extended ASCII characters (128-255) to "Courier New" in the selected text

properties.name: numberForm
properties.description: Specifies the number form setting for an OpenType font.

examples.description: Set the number form to old-style figures for the selected text to give numbers a more traditional, varying baseline appearance

properties.name: numberSpacing
properties.description: Specifies the number spacing setting for the font.

examples.description: Set the number spacing of selected text to tabular format so that numbers align vertically in columns

properties.name: outline
properties.description:
Specifies if the font is formatted as outlined. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text is outlined.
- false: None of the text is outlined.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text is outlined.

examples.description: Apply outline formatting to the selected text in the document

properties.name: position
properties.description: Specifies the position of text (in points) relative to the base line.

examples.description: Set the selected text to appear 6 points above the baseline as superscript positioning

properties.name: reflection
properties.description: Returns a ReflectionFormat object that represents the reflection formatting for a shape.

examples.description: Add a reflection effect to the text in the first paragraph with 50% transparency and 4 points offset

properties.name: scaling
properties.description: Specifies the scaling percentage applied to the font.

examples.description: Set the font scaling to 150% for the selected text to make it appear wider

properties.name: shadow
properties.description:
Specifies if the font is formatted as shadowed. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text is shadowed.
- false: None of the text is shadowed.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text is shadowed.

examples.description: Apply shadow formatting to the selected text in the document

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specifies a value that represents the font size in points.

examples.description: Change the font size of the currently selected text to 20 points.

properties.name: sizeBidirectional
properties.description: Specifies the font size in points for right-to-left text.

examples.description: Set the font size to 18 points for right-to-left text in the selected range

properties.name: smallCaps
properties.description:
Specifies whether the font is formatted as small caps, which makes lowercase letters appear as small uppercase letters. The possible values are as follows:
- true: All the text has the Small Caps attribute.
- false: None of the text has the Small Caps attribute.
- null: Returned if some, but not all, of the text has the Small Caps attribute.

examples.description: Format selected text to display in small caps style, making lowercase letters appear as small uppercase letters

properties.name: spacing
properties.description: Specifies the spacing between characters.

examples.description: Set the character spacing of the selected text to 3 points to make it more spread out

properties.name: strikeThrough
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font has a strikethrough. True if the font is formatted as strikethrough text, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Apply strikethrough formatting to the currently selected text in the document.

properties.name: stylisticSet
properties.description: Specifies the stylistic set for the font.

examples.description: Apply the stylistic set "Set05" to the selected text's font to use alternate character forms

properties.name: subscript
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font is a subscript. True if the font is formatted as subscript, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Format the chemical formula "H2O" so that the "2" appears as a subscript

properties.name: superscript
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the font is a superscript. True if the font is formatted as superscript, otherwise, false.

examples.description: Format the selected text as superscript (e.g., for mathematical exponents like xÂ²)

properties.name: textColor
properties.description: Returns a ColorFormat object that represents the color for the font.

examples.description: Change the text color of the first paragraph to red

properties.name: textShadow
properties.description: Returns a ShadowFormat object that specifies the shadow formatting for the font.

examples.description: Add a blue shadow with 5pt blur and 3pt offset to the selected text's font

properties.name: threeDimensionalFormat
properties.description: Returns a ThreeDimensionalFormat object that contains 3-dimensional (3D) effect formatting properties for the font.

examples.description: Apply a 3D bevel effect to the selected text's font

properties.name: underline
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates the font's underline type. 'None' if the font isn't underlined.

examples.description: Apply single underline formatting to the currently selected text in the document.

properties.name: underlineColor
properties.description: Specifies the color of the underline for the Font object. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format.

examples.description: Set the underline color of selected text to red (#FF0000)

methods.name: decreaseFontSize
methods.description: Decreases the font size to the next available size.

examples.description: Decrease the font size of the selected text to the next smaller available size

methods.name: increaseFontSize
methods.description: Increases the font size to the next available size.

examples.description: Increase the font size of the selected text to the next available size

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the font name and size of the first paragraph in the document
Remove all manual character formatting from the first paragraph to restore it to the default style

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Format the first paragraph's text by setting multiple font properties at once (bold, size, color, and font family)

methods.name: setAsTemplateDefault
methods.description: Sets the specified font formatting as the default for the active document and all new documents based on the active template.

examples.description: Set Arial font with 14pt size and blue color as the default font for the current document and all new documents based on the active template

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Font object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.FontData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get the font properties of the first paragraph as a plain JavaScript object for logging or data transfer purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Apply bold formatting to the first paragraph's font and track it to maintain the reference across multiple sync calls for further modifications

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Apply formatting to a paragraph's font, then untrack the font object to free memory after the changes are complete.
